intro: Raphionacme lucens, commonly known as the shining raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a slight fragrance. Raphionacme lucens is typically found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wet meadows.
